   17: 
   18: -module(argparse_SUITE).
   19: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   20: 
   21: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   22: 
   23: -export([
   24:     readme/0, readme/1,
   25:     basic/0, basic/1,
   26:     long_form_eq/0, long_form_eq/1,
   27:     built_in_types/0, built_in_types/1,
   28:     type_validators/0, type_validators/1,
   29:     invalid_arguments/0, invalid_arguments/1,
   30:     complex_command/0, complex_command/1,
   31:     unicode/0, unicode/1,
   32:     parser_error/0, parser_error/1,
   33:     nargs/0, nargs/1,
   34:     argparse/0, argparse/1,
   35:     negative/0, negative/1,
   36:     nodigits/0, nodigits/1,
   37:     pos_mixed_with_opt/0, pos_mixed_with_opt/1,
   38:     default_for_not_required/0, default_for_not_required/1,
   39:     global_default/0, global_default/1,
   40:     subcommand/0, subcommand/1,
   41:     very_short/0, very_short/1,
   42:     multi_short/0, multi_short/1,
   43:     proxy_arguments/0, proxy_arguments/1,
   44: 
   45:     usage/0, usage/1,
   46:     usage_required_args/0, usage_required_args/1,
   47:     usage_template/0, usage_template/1,
   48:     parser_error_usage/0, parser_error_usage/1,
   49:     command_usage/0, command_usage/1,
   50:     usage_width/0, usage_width/1,
   51: 
   52:     validator_exception/0, validator_exception/1,
   53:     validator_exception_format/0, validator_exception_format/1,
   54: 
   55:     run_handle/0, run_handle/1
   56: ]).
   57: 
   58: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   59: 
   60: suite() ->
   61:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 30}}].
   62: 
   63: groups() ->
   64:     [
   65:         {parser, [parallel], [
   66:             readme, basic, long_form_eq, built_in_types, type_validators,
   67:             invalid_arguments, complex_command, unicode, parser_error,
   68:             nargs, argparse, negative, nodigits, pos_mixed_with_opt,
   69:             default_for_not_required, global_default, subcommand,
   70:             very_short, multi_short, proxy_arguments
   71:         ]},
   72:         {usage, [parallel], [
   73:             usage, usage_required_args, usage_template,
   74:             parser_error_usage, command_usage, usage_width
   75:         ]},
   76:         {validator, [parallel], [
   77:             validator_exception, validator_exception_format
   78:         ]},
   79:         {run, [parallel], [
   80:             run_handle
   81:         ]}
   82:     ].
   83: 
   84: all() ->
   85:     [{group, parser}, {group, validator}, {group, usage}].
   86: 
   87: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   88: %% Helpers
   89: 
   90: prog() ->
   91:     {ok, [[ProgStr]]} = init:get_argument(progname), ProgStr.
   92: 
   93: parser_error(CmdLine, CmdMap) ->
   94:     {error, Reason} = parse(CmdLine, CmdMap),
   95:     unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:format_error(Reason)).
   96: 
   97: parse_opts(Args, Opts) ->
   98:     argparse:parse(string:lexemes(Args, " "), #{arguments => Opts}).
   99: 
  100: parse(Args, Command) ->
  101:     argparse:parse(string:lexemes(Args, " "), Command).
  102: 
  103: parse_cmd(Args, Command) ->
  104:     argparse:parse(string:lexemes(Args, " "), #{commands => Command}).
  105: 
  106: %% ubiquitous command, containing sub-commands, and all possible option types
  107: %% with all nargs. Not all combinations though.
  108: ubiq_cmd() ->
  109:     #{
  110:         arguments => [
  111:             #{name => r, short => $r, type => boolean, help => "recursive"},
  112:             #{name => f, short => $f, type => boolean, long => "-force", help => "force"},
  113:             #{name => v, short => $v, type => boolean, action => count, help => "verbosity level"},
  114:             #{name => interval, short => $i, type => {integer, [{min, 1}]}, help => "interval set"},
  115:             #{name => weird, long => "-req", help => "required optional, right?"},
  116:             #{name => float, long => "-float", type => float, default => 3.14, help => "floating-point long form argument"}
  117:         ],
  118:         commands => #{
  119:             "start" => #{help => "verifies configuration and starts server",
  120:                 arguments => [
  121:                     #{name => server, help => "server to start"},
  122:                     #{name => shard, short => $s, type => integer, nargs => nonempty_list, help => "initial shards"},
  123:                     #{name => part, short => $p, type => integer, nargs => list, help => hidden},
  124:                     #{name => z, short => $z, type => {integer, [{min, 1}, {max, 10}]}, help => "between"},
  125:                     #{name => l, short => $l, type => {integer, [{max, 10}]}, nargs => 'maybe', help => "maybe lower"},
  126:                     #{name => more, short => $m, type => {integer, [{max, 10}]}, help => "less than 10"},
  127:                     #{name => optpos, required => false, type => {integer, []}, help => "optional positional"},
  128:                     #{name => bin, short => $b, type => {binary, <<"m">>}, help => "binary with re"},
  129:                     #{name => g, short => $g, type => {binary, <<"m">>, []}, help => "binary with re"},
  130:                     #{name => t, short => $t, type => {string, "m"}, help => "string with re"},
  131:                     #{name => e, long => "--maybe-req", required => true, type => integer, nargs => 'maybe', help => "maybe required int"},
  132:                     #{name => y, required => true, long => "-yyy", short => $y, type => {string, "m", []}, help => "string with re"},
  133:                     #{name => u, short => $u, type => {string, ["1", "2"]}, help => "string choices"},
  134:                     #{name => choice, short => $c, type => {integer, [1,2,3]}, help => "tough choice"},
  135:                     #{name => fc, short => $q, type => {float, [2.1,1.2]}, help => "floating choice"},
  136:                     #{name => ac, short => $w, type => {atom, [one, two]}, help => "atom choice"},
  137:                     #{name => au, long => "-unsafe", type => {atom, unsafe}, help => "unsafe atom"},
  138:                     #{name => as, long => "-safe", type => atom, help => <<"safe atom">>},
  139:                     #{name => name, required => false, nargs => list, help => hidden},
  140:                     #{name => long, long => "foobar", required => false, help => [<<"foobaring option">>]}
  141:                 ], commands => #{
  142:                     "crawler" => #{arguments => [
  143:                         #{name => extra, long => "--extra", help => "extra option very deep"}
  144:                     ],
  145:                         help => "controls crawler behaviour"},
  146:                     "doze" => #{help => "dozes a bit"}}
  147:             },
  148:             "stop" => #{help => <<"stops running server">>, arguments => []
  149:             },
  150:             "status" => #{help => "prints server status", arguments => [],
  151:                 commands => #{
  152:                     "crawler" => #{
  153:                         arguments => [#{name => extra, long => "--extra", help => "extra option very deep"}],
  154:                         help => "crawler status"}}
  155:             },
  156:             "restart" => #{help => hidden, arguments => [
  157:                 #{name => server, help => "server to restart"},
  158:                 #{name => duo, short => $d, long => "-duo", help => "dual option"}
  159:             ]}
  160:     }
  161:     }.
  162: 
  163: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  164: %% Parser Test Cases
  165: 
  166: readme() ->
  167:     [{doc, "Test cases covered in the README"}].
  168: 
  169: readme(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  170:     Prog = prog(),
  171:     Rm = #{
  172:         arguments => [
  173:             #{name => dir},
  174:             #{name => force, short => $f, type => boolean, default => false},
  175:             #{name => recursive, short => $r, type => boolean}
  176:         ]
  177:     },
  178:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{dir => "dir", force => true, recursive => true}, [Prog], Rm},
  179:         argparse:parse(["-rf", "dir"], Rm)),
  180:     %% override progname
  181:     ?assertEqual("Usage:\n  readme\n",
  182:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(#{}, #{progname => "readme"}))),
  183:     ?assertEqual("Usage:\n  readme\n",
  184:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(#{}, #{progname => readme}))),
  185:     ?assertEqual("Usage:\n  readme\n",
  186:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(#{}, #{progname => <<"readme">>}))),
  187:     %% test that command has priority over just a positional argument:
  188:     %%  - parsing "opt sub" means "find positional argument "pos", then enter subcommand
  189:     %%  - parsing "sub opt" means "enter sub-command, and then find positional argument"
  190:     Cmd = #{
  191:         commands => #{"sub" => #{}},
  192:         arguments => [#{name => pos}]
  193:     },
  194:     ?assertEqual(parse("opt sub", Cmd), parse("sub opt", Cmd)).
  195: 
  196: basic() ->
  197:     [{doc, "Basic cases"}].
  198: 
  199: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  200:     Prog = prog(),
  201:     %% empty command, with full options path
  202:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{}, [Prog, "cmd"], #{}},
  203:         argparse:parse(["cmd"], #{commands => #{"cmd" => #{}}})),
  204:     %% sub-command, with no path, but user-supplied argument
  205:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{}, [Prog, "cmd", "sub"], #{attr => pos}},
  206:         argparse:parse(["cmd", "sub"], #{commands => #{"cmd" => #{commands => #{"sub" => #{attr => pos}}}}})),
  207:     %% command with positional argument
  208:     PosCmd = #{arguments => [#{name => pos}]},
  209:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{pos => "arg"}, [Prog, "cmd"], PosCmd},
  210:         argparse:parse(["cmd", "arg"], #{commands => #{"cmd" => PosCmd}})),
  211:     %% command with optional argument
  212:     OptCmd = #{arguments => [#{name => force, short => $f, type => boolean}]},
  213:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{force => true}, [Prog, "rm"], OptCmd},
  214:         parse(["rm -f"], #{commands => #{"rm" => OptCmd}}), "rm -f"),
  215:     %% command with optional and positional argument
  216:     PosOptCmd = #{arguments => [#{name => force, short => $f, type => boolean}, #{name => dir}]},
  217:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{force => true, dir => "dir"}, [Prog, "rm"], PosOptCmd},
  218:         parse(["rm -f dir"], #{commands => #{"rm" => PosOptCmd}}), "rm -f dir"),
  219:     %% no command, just argument list
  220:     KernelCmd = #{arguments => [#{name => kernel, long => "kernel", type => atom, nargs => 2}]},
  221:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{kernel => [port, dist]}, [Prog], KernelCmd},
  222:         parse(["-kernel port dist"], KernelCmd)),
  223:     %% same but positional
  224:     ArgListCmd = #{arguments => [#{name => arg, nargs => 2, type => boolean}]},
  225:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{arg => [true, false]}, [Prog], ArgListCmd},
  226:         parse(["true false"], ArgListCmd)).
  227: 
  228: long_form_eq() ->
  229:     [{doc, "Tests that long form supports --arg=value"}].
  230: 
  231: long_form_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  232:     Prog = prog(),
  233:     %% cmd --arg=value
  234:     PosOptCmd = #{arguments => [#{name => arg, long => "-arg"}]},
  235:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{arg => "value"}, [Prog, "cmd"], PosOptCmd},
  236:         parse(["cmd --arg=value"], #{commands => #{"cmd" => PosOptCmd}})),
  237:     %% --integer=10
  238:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{int := 10}, _, _},
  239:         parse(["--int=10"], #{arguments => [#{name => int, type => integer, long => "-int"}]})).
  240: 
  241: built_in_types() ->
  242:     [{doc, "Tests all built-in types supplied as a single argument"}].
  243: 
  244: % built-in types testing
  245: built_in_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  246:     Prog = [prog()],
  247:     Bool = #{arguments => [#{name => meta, type => boolean, short => $b, long => "-boolean"}]},
  248:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{}, Prog, Bool}, parse([""], Bool)),
  249:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{meta => true}, Prog, Bool}, parse(["-b"], Bool)),
  250:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{meta => true}, Prog, Bool}, parse(["--boolean"], Bool)),
  251:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{meta => false}, Prog, Bool}, parse(["--boolean false"], Bool)),
  252:     %% integer tests
  253:     Int = #{arguments => [#{name => int, type => integer, short => $i, long => "-int"}]},
  254:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{int => 1}, Prog, Int}, parse([" -i 1"], Int)),
  255:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{int => 1}, Prog, Int}, parse(["--int 1"], Int)),
  256:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{int => -1}, Prog, Int}, parse(["-i -1"], Int)),
  257:     %% floating point
  258:     Float = #{arguments => [#{name => f, type => float, short => $f}]},
  259:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{f => 44.44}, Prog, Float}, parse(["-f 44.44"], Float)),
  260:     %% atoms, existing
  261:     Atom = #{arguments => [#{name => atom, type => atom, short => $a, long => "-atom"}]},
  262:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{atom => atom}, Prog, Atom}, parse(["-a atom"], Atom)),
  263:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{atom => atom}, Prog, Atom}, parse(["--atom atom"], Atom)).
  264: 
  265: type_validators() ->
  266:     [{doc, "Test that parser return expected conversions for valid arguments"}].
  267: 
  268: type_validators(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  269:     %% successful string regexes
  270:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{str := "me"}, _, _},
  271:         parse_opts("me", [#{name => str, type => {string, "m."}}])),
  272:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{str := "me"}, _, _},
  273:         parse_opts("me", [#{name => str, type => {string, "m.", []}}])),
  274:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{"str" := "me"}, _, _},
  275:         parse_opts("me", [#{name => "str", type => {string, "m.", [{capture, none}]}}])),
  276:     %% and binary too...
  277:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{bin := <<"me">>}, _, _},
  278:         parse_opts("me", [#{name => bin, type => {binary, <<"m.">>}}])),
  279:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{<<"bin">> := <<"me">>}, _, _},
  280:         parse_opts("me", [#{name => <<"bin">>, type => {binary, <<"m.">>, []}}])),
  281:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{bin := <<"me">>}, _, _},
  282:         parse_opts("me", [#{name => bin, type => {binary, <<"m.">>, [{capture, none}]}}])),
  283:     %% successful integer with range validators
  284:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{int := 5}, _, _},
  285:         parse_opts("5", [#{name => int, type => {integer, [{min, 0}, {max, 10}]}}])),
  286:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{bin := <<"5">>}, _, _},
  287:         parse_opts("5", [#{name => bin, type => binary}])),
  288:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{str := "011"}, _, _},
  289:         parse_opts("11", [#{name => str, type => {custom, fun(S) -> [$0|S] end}}])),
  290:     %% choices: valid
  291:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{bin := <<"K">>}, _, _},
  292:         parse_opts("K", [#{name => bin, type => {binary, [<<"M">>, <<"K">>]}}])),
  293:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{str := "K"}, _, _},
  294:         parse_opts("K", [#{name => str, type => {string, ["K", "N"]}}])),
  295:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{atom := one}, _, _},
  296:         parse_opts("one", [#{name => atom, type => {atom, [one, two]}}])),
  297:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{int := 12}, _, _},
  298:         parse_opts("12", [#{name => int, type => {integer, [10, 12]}}])),
  299:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{float := 1.3}, _, _},
  300:         parse_opts("1.3", [#{name => float, type => {float, [1.3, 1.4]}}])),
  301:     %% test for unsafe atom
  302:     %% ensure the atom does not exist
  303:     ?assertException(error, badarg, list_to_existing_atom("$can_never_be")),
  304:     {ok, ArgMap, _, _} = parse_opts("$can_never_be", [#{name => atom, type => {atom, unsafe}}]),
  305:     argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => atom, type => {atom, unsafe}}]}),
  306:     %% now that atom exists, because argparse created it (in an unsafe way!)
  307:     ?assertEqual(list_to_existing_atom("$can_never_be"), maps:get(atom, ArgMap)),
  308:     %% test successful user-defined conversion
  309:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{user := "VER"}, _, _},
  310:         parse_opts("REV", [#{name => user, type => {custom, fun (Str) -> lists:reverse(Str) end}}])).
  311: 
  312: invalid_arguments() ->
  313:     [{doc, "Test that parser return errors for invalid arguments"}].
  314: 
  315: invalid_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  316:     %% {float, [{min, float()} | {max, float()}]} |
  317:     Prog = [prog()],
  318:     MinFloat = #{name => float, type => {float, [{min, 1.0}]}},
  319:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, MinFloat, "0.0", <<"is less than accepted minimum">>}},
  320:         parse_opts("0.0", [MinFloat])),
  321:     MaxFloat = #{name => float, type => {float, [{max, 1.0}]}},
  322:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, MaxFloat, "2.0", <<"is greater than accepted maximum">>}},
  323:         parse_opts("2.0", [MaxFloat])),
  324:     %% {int, [{min, integer()} | {max, integer()}]} |
  325:     MinInt = #{name => int, type => {integer, [{min, 20}]}},
  326:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, MinInt, "10", <<"is less than accepted minimum">>}},
  327:         parse_opts("10", [MinInt])),
  328:     MaxInt = #{name => int, type => {integer, [{max, -10}]}},
  329:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, MaxInt, "-5", <<"is greater than accepted maximum">>}},
  330:         parse_opts("-5", [MaxInt])),
  331:     %% string: regex & regex with options
  332:     %% {string, string()} | {string, string(), []}
  333:     StrRegex = #{name => str, type => {string, "me.me"}},
  334:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, StrRegex, "me", <<"does not match">>}},
  335:         parse_opts("me", [StrRegex])),
  336:     StrRegexOpt = #{name => str, type => {string, "me.me", []}},
  337:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, StrRegexOpt, "me", <<"does not match">>}},
  338:         parse_opts("me", [StrRegexOpt])),
  339:     %% {binary, {re, binary()} | {re, binary(), []}
  340:     BinRegex = #{name => bin, type => {binary, <<"me.me">>}},
  341:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, BinRegex, "me", <<"does not match">>}},
  342:         parse_opts("me", [BinRegex])),
  343:     BinRegexOpt = #{name => bin, type => {binary, <<"me.me">>, []}},
  344:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, BinRegexOpt, "me", <<"does not match">>}},
  345:         parse_opts("me", [BinRegexOpt])),
  346:     %% invalid integer (comma , is not parsed)
  347:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, MinInt, "1,", <<"is not an integer">>}},
  348:         parse_opts(["1,"], [MinInt])),
  349:     %% test invalid choices
  350:     BinChoices = #{name => bin, type => {binary, [<<"M">>, <<"N">>]}},
  351:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, BinChoices, "K", <<"is not one of the choices">>}},
  352:         parse_opts("K", [BinChoices])),
  353:     StrChoices = #{name => str, type => {string, ["M", "N"]}},
  354:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, StrChoices, "K", <<"is not one of the choices">>}},
  355:         parse_opts("K", [StrChoices])),
  356:     AtomChoices = #{name => atom, type => {atom, [one, two]}},
  357:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, AtomChoices, "K", <<"is not one of the choices">>}},
  358:         parse_opts("K", [AtomChoices])),
  359:     IntChoices = #{name => int, type => {integer, [10, 11]}},
  360:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, IntChoices, "12", <<"is not one of the choices">>}},
  361:         parse_opts("12", [IntChoices])),
  362:     FloatChoices = #{name => float, type => {float, [1.2, 1.4]}},
  363:     ?assertEqual({error, {Prog, FloatChoices, "1.3", <<"is not one of the choices">>}},
  364:         parse_opts("1.3", [FloatChoices])),
  365:     %% unsuccessful user-defined conversion
  366:     ?assertMatch({error, {Prog, _, "REV", <<"failed faildation">>}},
  367:         parse_opts("REV", [#{name => user, type => {custom, fun (Str) -> integer_to_binary(Str) end}}])).
  368: 
  369: complex_command() ->
  370:     [{doc, "Parses a complex command that has a mix of optional and positional arguments"}].
  371: 
  372: complex_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  373:     Command = #{arguments => [
  374:         %% options
  375:         #{name => string, short => $s, long => "-string", action => append, help => "String list option"},
  376:         #{name => boolean, type => boolean, short => $b, action => append, help => "Boolean list option"},
  377:         #{name => float, type => float, short => $f, long => "-float", action => append, help => "Float option"},
  378:         %% positional args
  379:         #{name => integer, type => integer, help => "Integer variable"},
  380:         #{name => string, help => "alias for string option", action => extend, nargs => list}
  381:     ]},
  382:     CmdMap = #{commands => #{"start" => Command}},
  383:     Parsed = argparse:parse(string:lexemes("start --float 1.04 -f 112 -b -b -s s1 42 --string s2 s3 s4", " "), CmdMap),
  384:     Expected = #{float => [1.04, 112], boolean => [true, true], integer => 42, string => ["s1", "s2", "s3", "s4"]},
  385:     ?assertEqual({ok, Expected, [prog(), "start"], Command}, Parsed).
  386: 
  387: unicode() ->
  388:     [{doc, "Tests basic unicode support"}].
  389: 
  390: unicode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     %% test unicode short & long
  392:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{one := true}, _, _},
  393:         parse(["-Ф"], #{arguments => [#{name => one, short => $Ф, type => boolean}]})),
  394:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{long := true}, _, _},
  395:         parse(["--åäö"], #{arguments => [#{name => long, long => "-åäö", type => boolean}]})),
  396:     %% test default, help and value in unicode
  397:     Cmd = #{arguments => [#{name => text, type => binary, help => "åäö", default => <<"★"/utf8>>}]},
  398:     Expected = #{text => <<"★"/utf8>>},
  399:     Prog = [prog()],
  400:     ?assertEqual({ok, Expected, Prog, Cmd}, argparse:parse([], Cmd)), %% default
  401:     ?assertEqual({ok, Expected, Prog, Cmd}, argparse:parse(["★"], Cmd)), %% specified in the command line
  402:     ?assertEqual("Usage:\n  " ++ prog() ++ " <text>\n\nArguments:\n  text åäö (binary), default: ★\n",
  403:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd))),
  404:     %% test command name and argument name in unicode
  405:     Uni = #{commands => #{"åäö" => #{help => "öФ"}}, handler => optional,
  406:         arguments => [#{name => "Ф", short => $ä, long => "åäö"}]},
  407:     UniExpected = "Usage:\n  " ++ prog() ++
  408:         " {åäö} [-ä <Ф>] [-åäö <Ф>]\n\nSubcommands:\n  åäö      öФ\n\nOptional arguments:\n  -ä, -åäö Ф\n",
  409:     ?assertEqual(UniExpected, unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Uni))),
  410:     ParsedExpected = #{"Ф" => "öФ"},
  411:     ?assertEqual({ok, ParsedExpected, Prog, Uni}, argparse:parse(["-ä", "öФ"], Uni)).
  412: 
  413: parser_error() ->
  414:     [{doc, "Tests error tuples that the parser returns"}].
  415: 
  416: parser_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  417:     Prog = prog(),
  418:     %% unknown option at the top of the path
  419:     ?assertEqual({error, {[Prog], undefined, "arg", <<>>}},
  420:         parse_cmd(["arg"], #{})),
  421:     %% positional argument missing in a sub-command
  422:     Opt = #{name => mode, required => true},
  423:     ?assertMatch({error, {[Prog, "start"], _, undefined, <<>>}},
  424:         parse_cmd(["start"], #{"start" => #{arguments => [Opt]}})),
  425:     %% optional argument missing in a sub-command
  426:     Opt1 = #{name => mode, short => $o, required => true},
  427:     ?assertMatch({error, {[Prog, "start"], _, undefined, <<>>}},
  428:         parse_cmd(["start"], #{"start" => #{arguments => [Opt1]}})),
  429:     %% positional argument: an atom that does not exist
  430:     Opt2 = #{name => atom, type => atom},
  431:     ?assertEqual({error, {[Prog], Opt2, "boo-foo", <<"is not an existing atom">>}},
  432:         parse_opts(["boo-foo"], [Opt2])),
  433:     %% optional argument missing some items
  434:     Opt3 = #{name => kernel, long => "kernel", type => atom, nargs => 2},
  435:     ?assertEqual({error, {[Prog], Opt3, ["port"], "expected 2, found 1 argument(s)"}},
  436:         parse_opts(["-kernel port"], [Opt3])),
  437:     %% positional argument missing some items
  438:     Opt4 = #{name => arg, type => atom, nargs => 3},
  439:     ?assertEqual({error, {[Prog], Opt4, ["p1"], "expected 3, found 1 argument(s)"}},
  440:         parse_opts(["p1"], [Opt4])),
  441:     %% short option with no argument, when it's needed
  442:     ?assertMatch({error, {_, _, undefined, <<"expected argument">>}},
  443:         parse("-1", #{arguments => [#{name => short49, short => 49}]})).
  444: 
  445: nargs() ->
  446:     [{doc, "Tests argument consumption option, with nargs"}].
  447: 
  448: nargs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  449:     Prog = [prog()],
  450:     %% consume optional list arguments
  451:     Opts = [
  452:         #{name => arg, short => $s, nargs => list, type => integer},
  453:         #{name => bool, short => $b, type => boolean}
  454:     ],
  455:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{arg := [1, 2, 3], bool := true}, _, _},
  456:         parse_opts(["-s 1 2 3 -b"], Opts)),
  457:     %% consume one_or_more arguments in an optional list
  458:     Opts2 = [
  459:         #{name => arg, short => $s, nargs => nonempty_list},
  460:         #{name => extra, short => $x}
  461:         ],
  462:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{extra := "X", arg := ["a","b","c"]}, _, _},
  463:         parse_opts(["-s port -s a b c -x X"], Opts2)),
  464:     %% error if there is no argument to consume
  465:     ?assertMatch({error, {_, _, ["-x"], <<"expected argument">>}},
  466:         parse_opts(["-s -x"], Opts2)),
  467:     %% error when positional has nargs = nonempty_list or pos_integer
  468:     ?assertMatch({error, {_, _, undefined, <<>>}},
  469:         parse_opts([""], [#{name => req, nargs => nonempty_list}])),
  470:     %% positional arguments consumption: one or more positional argument
  471:     OptsPos1 = #{arguments => [
  472:         #{name => arg, nargs => nonempty_list},
  473:         #{name => extra, short => $x}
  474:     ]},
  475:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{extra => "X", arg => ["b","c"]}, Prog, OptsPos1},
  476:         parse(["-x port -x a b c -x X"], OptsPos1)),
  477:     %% positional arguments consumption, any number (maybe zero)
  478:     OptsPos2 = #{arguments => [
  479:         #{name => arg, nargs => list},
  480:         #{name => extra, short => $x}
  481:     ]},
  482:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{extra => "X", arg => ["a","b","c"]}, Prog, OptsPos2},
  483:         parse(["-x port a b c -x X"], OptsPos2)),
  484:     %% positional: consume ALL arguments!
  485:     OptsAll = #{arguments => [
  486:         #{name => arg, nargs => all},
  487:         #{name => extra, short => $x}
  488:     ]},
  489:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{extra => "port", arg => ["a","b","c", "-x", "X"]}, Prog, OptsAll},
  490:         parse(["-x port a b c -x X"], OptsAll)),
  491:     %% maybe with a specified default
  492:     OptMaybe = [
  493:         #{name => foo, long => "-foo", nargs => {'maybe', c}, default => d},
  494:         #{name => bar, nargs => 'maybe', default => d}
  495:     ],
  496:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := "YY", bar := "XX"}, Prog, _},
  497:         parse_opts(["XX --foo YY"], OptMaybe)),
  498:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := c, bar := "XX"}, Prog, _},
  499:         parse_opts(["XX --foo"], OptMaybe)),
  500:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := d, bar := d}, Prog, _},
  501:         parse_opts([""], OptMaybe)),
  502:     %% maybe with default provided by argparse
  503:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := d, bar := "XX", baz := ok}, _, _},
  504:         parse_opts(["XX -b"], [#{name => baz, nargs => 'maybe', short => $b, default => ok} | OptMaybe])),
  505:     %% maybe arg - with no default given
  506:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := d, bar := "XX", baz := 0}, _, _},
  507:         parse_opts(["XX -b"], [#{name => baz, nargs => 'maybe', short => $b, type => integer} | OptMaybe])),
  508:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := d, bar := "XX", baz := ""}, _, _},
  509:         parse_opts(["XX -b"], [#{name => baz, nargs => 'maybe', short => $b, type => string} | OptMaybe])),
  510:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := d, bar := "XX", baz := undefined}, _, _},
  511:         parse_opts(["XX -b"], [#{name => baz, nargs => 'maybe', short => $b, type => atom} | OptMaybe])),
  512:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := d, bar := "XX", baz := <<"">>}, _, _},
  513:         parse_opts(["XX -b"], [#{name => baz, nargs => 'maybe', short => $b, type => binary} | OptMaybe])),
  514:     %% nargs: optional list, yet it still needs to be 'not required'!
  515:     OptList = [#{name => arg, nargs => list, required => false, type => integer}],
  516:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{}, Prog, #{arguments => OptList}}, parse_opts("", OptList)),
  517:     %% tests that action "count" with nargs "maybe" counts two times, first time
  518:     %% consuming an argument (for "maybe"), second time just counting
  519:     Cmd = #{arguments => [
  520:         #{name => short49, short => $1, long => "-force", action => count, nargs => 'maybe'}]},
  521:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{short49 => 2}, Prog, Cmd},
  522:         parse("-1 arg1 --force", Cmd)).
  523: 
  524: argparse() ->
  525:     [{doc, "Tests success cases, inspired by argparse in Python"}].
  526: 
  527: argparse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  528:     Prog = [prog()],
  529:     Parser = #{arguments => [
  530:         #{name => sum, long => "-sum", action => {store, sum}, default => max},
  531:         #{name => integers, type => integer, nargs => nonempty_list}
  532:         ]},
  533:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{integers => [1, 2, 3, 4], sum => max}, Prog, Parser},
  534:         parse("1 2 3 4", Parser)),
  535:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{integers => [1, 2, 3, 4], sum => sum}, Prog, Parser},
  536:         parse("1 2 3 4 --sum", Parser)),
  537:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{integers => [7, -1, 42], sum => sum}, Prog, Parser},
  538:         parse("--sum 7 -1 42", Parser)),
  539:     %% name or flags
  540:     Parser2 = #{arguments => [
  541:         #{name => bar, required => true},
  542:         #{name => foo, short => $f, long => "-foo"}
  543:     ]},
  544:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{bar => "BAR"}, Prog, Parser2}, parse("BAR", Parser2)),
  545:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{bar => "BAR", foo => "FOO"}, Prog, Parser2}, parse("BAR --foo FOO", Parser2)),
  546:     %PROG: error: the following arguments are required: bar
  547:     ?assertMatch({error, {Prog, _, undefined, <<>>}}, parse("--foo FOO", Parser2)),
  548:     %% action tests: default
  549:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := "1"}, Prog, _},
  550:         parse("--foo 1", #{arguments => [#{name => foo, long => "-foo"}]})),
  551:     %% action test: store
  552:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := 42}, Prog, _},
  553:         parse("--foo", #{arguments => [#{name => foo, long => "-foo", action => {store, 42}}]})),
  554:     %% action tests: boolean (variants)
  555:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := true}, Prog, _},
  556:         parse("--foo", #{arguments => [#{name => foo, long => "-foo", action => {store, true}}]})),
  557:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := 42}, Prog, _},
  558:         parse("--foo", #{arguments => [#{name => foo, long => "-foo", type => boolean, action => {store, 42}}]})),
  559:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := true}, Prog, _},
  560:         parse("--foo", #{arguments => [#{name => foo, long => "-foo", type => boolean}]})),
  561:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := true}, Prog, _},
  562:         parse("--foo true", #{arguments => [#{name => foo, long => "-foo", type => boolean}]})),
  563:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := false}, Prog, _},
  564:         parse("--foo false", #{arguments => [#{name => foo, long => "-foo", type => boolean}]})),
  565:     %% action tests: append & append_const
  566:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{all := [1, "1"]}, Prog, _},
  567:         parse("--x 1 -x 1", #{arguments => [
  568:             #{name => all, long => "-x", type => integer, action => append},
  569:             #{name => all, short => $x, action => append}]})),
  570:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{all := ["Z", 2]}, Prog, _},
  571:         parse("--x -x", #{arguments => [
  572:             #{name => all, long => "-x", action => {append, "Z"}},
  573:             #{name => all, short => $x, action => {append, 2}}]})),
  574:     %% count:
  575:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{v := 3}, Prog, _},
  576:         parse("-v -v -v", #{arguments => [#{name => v, short => $v, action => count}]})).
  577: 
  578: negative() ->
  579:     [{doc, "Test negative number parser"}].
  580: 
  581: negative(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     Parser = #{arguments => [
  583:         #{name => x, short => $x, type => integer, action => store},
  584:         #{name => foo, nargs => 'maybe', required => false}
  585:     ]},
  586:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{x := -1}, _, _}, parse("-x -1", Parser)),
  587:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{x := -1, foo := "-5"}, _, _}, parse("-x -1 -5", Parser)),
  588:     %%
  589:     Parser2 = #{arguments => [
  590:         #{name => one, short => $1},
  591:         #{name => foo, nargs => 'maybe', required => false}
  592:     ]},
  593: 
  594:     %% negative number options present, so -1 is an option
  595:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{one := "X"}, _, _}, parse("-1 X", Parser2)),
  596:     %% negative number options present, so -2 is an option
  597:     ?assertMatch({error, {_, undefined, "-2", _}}, parse("-2", Parser2)),
  598: 
  599:     %% negative number options present, so both -1s are options
  600:     ?assertMatch({error, {_, _, undefined, _}}, parse("-1 -1", Parser2)),
  601:     %% no "-" prefix, can only be an integer
  602:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{foo := "-1"}, _, _}, argparse:parse(["-1"], Parser2, #{prefixes => "+"})),
  603:     %% no "-" prefix, can only be an integer, but just one integer!
  604:     ?assertMatch({error, {_, undefined, "-1", _}},
  605:         argparse:parse(["-2", "-1"], Parser2, #{prefixes => "+"})),
  606:     %% just in case, floats work that way too...
  607:     ?assertMatch({error, {_, undefined, "-2", _}},
  608:         parse("-2", #{arguments => [#{name => one, long => "1.2"}]})).
  609: 
  610: nodigits() ->
  611:     [{doc, "Test prefixes and negative numbers together"}].
  612: 
  613: nodigits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  614:     %% verify nodigits working as expected
  615:     Parser3 = #{arguments => [
  616:         #{name => extra, short => $3},
  617:         #{name => arg, nargs => list}
  618:     ]},
  619:     %% ensure not to consume optional prefix
  620:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{extra => "X", arg => ["a","b","3"]}, [prog()], Parser3},
  621:         argparse:parse(string:lexemes("-3 port a b 3 +3 X", " "), Parser3, #{prefixes => "-+"})).
  622: 
  623: pos_mixed_with_opt() ->
  624:     [{doc, "Tests that optional argument correctly consumes expected argument"
  625:         "inspired by https://github.com/python/cpython/issues/59317"}].
  626: 
  627: pos_mixed_with_opt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  628:     Parser = #{arguments => [
  629:         #{name => pos},
  630:         #{name => opt, default => 24, type => integer, long => "-opt"},
  631:         #{name => vars, nargs => list}
  632:     ]},
  633:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{pos => "1", opt => 8, vars => ["8", "9"]}, [prog()], Parser},
  634:         parse("1 2 --opt 8 8 9", Parser)).
  635: 
  636: default_for_not_required() ->
  637:     [{doc, "Tests that default value is used for non-required positional argument"}].
  638: 
  639: default_for_not_required(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  640:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{def := 1}, _, _},
  641:         parse("", #{arguments => [#{name => def, short => $d, required => false, default => 1}]})),
  642:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{def := 1}, _, _},
  643:         parse("", #{arguments => [#{name => def, required => false, default => 1}]})).
  644: 
  645: global_default() ->
  646:     [{doc, "Tests that a global default can be enabled for all non-required arguments"}].
  647: 
  648: global_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  649:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{def := "global"}, _, _},
  650:         argparse:parse("", #{arguments => [#{name => def, type => integer, required => false}]},
  651:         #{default => "global"})).
  652: 
  653: subcommand() ->
  654:     [{doc, "Tests subcommands parser"}].
  655: 
  656: subcommand(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  657:     TwoCmd = #{arguments => [#{name => bar}]},
  658:     Cmd = #{
  659:         arguments => [#{name => force, type => boolean, short => $f}],
  660:         commands => #{"one" => #{
  661:             arguments => [#{name => foo, type => boolean, long => "-foo"}, #{name => baz}],
  662:             commands => #{
  663:                 "two" => TwoCmd}}}},
  664:     ?assertEqual({ok, #{force => true, baz => "N1O1O", foo => true, bar => "bar"}, [prog(), "one", "two"], TwoCmd},
  665:         parse("one N1O1O -f two --foo bar", Cmd)),
  666:     %% it is an error not to choose subcommand
  667:     ?assertEqual({error, {[prog(), "one"], undefined, undefined, <<"subcommand expected">>}},
  668:         parse("one N1O1O -f", Cmd)).
  669: 
  670: very_short() ->
  671:     [{doc, "Tests short option appended to the optional itself"}].
  672: 
  673: very_short(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  674:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{x := "V"}, _, _},
  675:         parse("-xV", #{arguments => [#{name => x, short => $x}]})).
  676: 
  677: multi_short() ->
  678:     [{doc, "Tests multiple short arguments blend into one"}].
  679: 
  680: multi_short(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  681:     %% ensure non-flammable argument does not explode, even when it's possible
  682:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{v := "xv"}, _, _},
  683:         parse("-vxv", #{arguments => [#{name => v, short => $v}, #{name => x, short => $x}]})),
  684:     %% ensure 'verbosity' use-case works
  685:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{v := 3}, _, _},
  686:         parse("-vvv", #{arguments => [#{name => v, short => $v, action => count}]})),
  687:     %%
  688:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{recursive := true, force := true, path := "dir"}, _, _},
  689:         parse("-rf dir", #{arguments => [
  690:             #{name => recursive, short => $r, type => boolean},
  691:             #{name => force, short => $f, type => boolean},
  692:             #{name => path}
  693:             ]})).
  694: 
  695: proxy_arguments() ->
  696:     [{doc, "Tests nargs => all used to proxy arguments to another script"}].
  697: 
  698: proxy_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  699:     Cmd = #{
  700:         commands => #{
  701:             "start" => #{
  702:                 arguments => [
  703:                     #{name => shell, short => $s, long => "-shell", type => boolean},
  704:                     #{name => skip, short => $x, long => "-skip", type => boolean},
  705:                     #{name => args, required => false, nargs => all}
  706:                 ]
  707:             },
  708:             "stop" => #{},
  709:             "status" => #{
  710:                 arguments => [
  711:                     #{name => skip, required => false, default => "ok"},
  712:                     #{name => args, required => false, nargs => all}
  713:                 ]},
  714:             "state" => #{
  715:                 arguments => [
  716:                     #{name => skip, required => false},
  717:                     #{name => args, required => false, nargs => all}
  718:                 ]}
  719:         },
  720:         arguments => [
  721:             #{name => node}
  722:         ],
  723:         handler => fun (#{}) -> ok end
  724:     },
  725:     Prog = prog(),
  726:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{node := "node1"}, _, _}, parse("node1", Cmd)),
  727:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{node := "node1"}, [Prog, "stop"], #{}}, parse("node1 stop", Cmd)),
  728:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{node := "node2.org", shell := true, skip := true}, _, _}, parse("node2.org start -x -s", Cmd)),
  729:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{args := ["-app","key","value"],node := "node1.org"}, [Prog, "start"], _},
  730:         parse("node1.org start -app key value", Cmd)),
  731:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{args := ["-app","key","value", "-app2", "key2", "value2"],
  732:         node := "node3.org", shell := true}, [Prog, "start"], _},
  733:         parse("node3.org start -s -app key value -app2 key2 value2", Cmd)),
  734:     %% test that any non-required positionals are skipped
  735:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{args := ["-a","bcd"], node := "node2.org", skip := "ok"}, _, _}, parse("node2.org status -a bcd", Cmd)),
  736:     ?assertMatch({ok, #{args := ["-app", "key"], node := "node2.org"}, _, _}, parse("node2.org state -app key", Cmd)).
  737: 
  738: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  739: %% Usage Test Cases
  740: 
  741: usage() ->
  742:     [{doc, "Basic tests for help formatter, including 'hidden' help"}].
  743: 
  744: usage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  745:     Cmd = ubiq_cmd(),
  746:     Usage = "Usage:\n  erl start {crawler|doze} [-lrfv] [-s <shard>...] [-z <z>] [-m <more>] [-b <bin>]\n"
  747:         "      [-g <g>] [-t <t>] ---maybe-req -y <y> --yyy <y> [-u <u>] [-c <choice>]\n"
  748:         "      [-q <fc>] [-w <ac>] [--unsafe <au>] [--safe <as>] [-foobar <long>] [--force]\n"
  749:         "      [-i <interval>] [--req <weird>] [--float <float>] <server> [<optpos>]\n\n"
  750:         "Subcommands:\n"
  751:         "  crawler      controls crawler behaviour\n"
  752:         "  doze         dozes a bit\n\n"
  753:         "Arguments:\n"
  754:         "  server       server to start\n"
  755:         "  optpos       optional positional (int)\n\n"
  756:         "Optional arguments:\n"
  757:         "  -s           initial shards (int)\n"
  758:         "  -z           between (1 <= int <= 10)\n"
  759:         "  -l           maybe lower (int <= 10)\n"
  760:         "  -m           less than 10 (int <= 10)\n"
  761:         "  -b           binary with re (binary re: m)\n"
  762:         "  -g           binary with re (binary re: m)\n"
  763:         "  -t           string with re (string re: m)\n"
  764:         "  ---maybe-req maybe required int (int)\n"
  765:         "  -y, --yyy    string with re (string re: m)\n"
  766:         "  -u           string choices (choice: 1, 2)\n"
  767:         "  -c           tough choice (choice: 1, 2, 3)\n"
  768:         "  -q           floating choice (choice: 2.10000, 1.20000)\n"
  769:         "  -w           atom choice (choice: one, two)\n"
  770:         "  --unsafe     unsafe atom (atom)\n"
  771:         "  --safe       safe atom (existing atom)\n"
  772:         "  -foobar      foobaring option\n"
  773:         "  -r           recursive\n"
  774:         "  -f, --force  force\n"
  775:         "  -v           verbosity level\n"
  776:         "  -i           interval set (int >= 1)\n"
  777:         "  --req        required optional, right?\n"
  778:         "  --float      floating-point long form argument (float), default: 3.14\n",
  779:     ?assertEqual(Usage, unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd,
  780:         #{progname => "erl", command => ["start"]}))),
  781:     FullCmd = "Usage:\n  erl"
  782:         " <command> [-rfv] [--force] [-i <interval>] [--req <weird>] [--float <float>]\n\n"
  783:         "Subcommands:\n"
  784:         "  start       verifies configuration and starts server\n"
  785:         "  status      prints server status\n"
  786:         "  stop        stops running server\n\n"
  787:         "Optional arguments:\n"
  788:         "  -r          recursive\n"
  789:         "  -f, --force force\n"
  790:         "  -v          verbosity level\n"
  791:         "  -i          interval set (int >= 1)\n"
  792:         "  --req       required optional, right?\n"
  793:         "  --float     floating-point long form argument (float), default: 3.14\n",
  794:     ?assertEqual(FullCmd, unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd,
  795:         #{progname => erl}))),
  796:     CrawlerStatus = "Usage:\n  erl status crawler [-rfv] [---extra <extra>] [--force] [-i <interval>]\n"
  797:         "      [--req <weird>] [--float <float>]\n\nOptional arguments:\n"
  798:         "  ---extra    extra option very deep\n  -r          recursive\n"
  799:         "  -f, --force force\n  -v          verbosity level\n"
  800:         "  -i          interval set (int >= 1)\n"
  801:         "  --req       required optional, right?\n"
  802:         "  --float     floating-point long form argument (float), default: 3.14\n",
  803:     ?assertEqual(CrawlerStatus, unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd,
  804:         #{progname => "erl", command => ["status", "crawler"]}))),
  805:     ok.
  806: 
  807: usage_required_args() ->
  808:     [{doc, "Verify that required args are printed as required in usage"}].
  809: 
  810: usage_required_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  811:     Cmd = #{commands => #{"test" => #{arguments => [#{name => required, required => true, long => "-req"}]}}},
  812:     Expected = "Usage:\n  " ++ prog() ++ " test --req <required>\n\nOptional arguments:\n  --req required\n",
  813:     ?assertEqual(Expected, unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd, #{command => ["test"]}))).
  814: 
  815: usage_template() ->
  816:     [{doc, "Tests templates in help/usage"}].
  817: 
  818: usage_template(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  819:     %% Argument (positional)
  820:     Cmd = #{arguments => [#{
  821:         name => shard,
  822:         type => integer,
  823:         default => 0,
  824:         help => {"[-s SHARD]", ["initial number, ", type, <<" with a default value of ">>, default]}}
  825:     ]},
  826:     ?assertEqual("Usage:\n  " ++ prog() ++ " [-s SHARD]\n\nArguments:\n  shard initial number, int with a default value of 0\n",
  827:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd, #{}))),
  828:     %% Optional
  829:     Cmd1 = #{arguments => [#{
  830:         name => shard,
  831:         short => $s,
  832:         type => integer,
  833:         default => 0,
  834:         help => {<<"[-s SHARD]">>, ["initial number"]}}
  835:     ]},
  836:     ?assertEqual("Usage:\n  " ++ prog() ++ " [-s SHARD]\n\nOptional arguments:\n  -s initial number\n",
  837:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd1, #{}))),
  838:     %% ISO Date example
  839:     DefaultRange = {{2020, 1, 1}, {2020, 6, 22}},
  840:     CmdISO = #{
  841:         arguments => [
  842:             #{
  843:                 name => range,
  844:                 long => "-range",
  845:                 short => $r,
  846:                 help => {"[--range RNG]", fun() ->
  847:                     {{FY, FM, FD}, {TY, TM, TD}} = DefaultRange,
  848:                     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("date range, ~b-~b-~b..~b-~b-~b", [FY, FM, FD, TY, TM, TD]))
  849:                                               end},
  850:                 type => {custom, fun(S) -> [S, DefaultRange] end},
  851:                 default => DefaultRange
  852:             }
  853:         ]
  854:     },
  855:     ?assertEqual("Usage:\n  " ++ prog() ++ " [--range RNG]\n\nOptional arguments:\n  -r, --range date range, 2020-1-1..2020-6-22\n",
  856:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(CmdISO, #{}))),
  857:     ok.
  858: 
  859: parser_error_usage() ->
  860:     [{doc, "Tests that parser errors have corresponding usage text"}].
  861: 
  862: parser_error_usage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  863:     %% unknown arguments
  864:     Prog = prog(),
  865:     ?assertEqual(Prog ++ ": unknown argument: arg", parser_error(["arg"], #{})),
  866:     ?assertEqual(Prog ++ ": unknown argument: -a", parser_error(["-a"], #{})),
  867:     %% missing argument
  868:     ?assertEqual(Prog ++ ": required argument missing: need", parser_error([""],
  869:         #{arguments => [#{name => need}]})),
  870:     ?assertEqual(Prog ++ ": required argument missing: need", parser_error([""],
  871:         #{arguments => [#{name => need, short => $n, required => true}]})),
  872:     %% invalid value
  873:     ?assertEqual(Prog ++ ": invalid argument for need: foo is not an integer", parser_error(["foo"],
  874:         #{arguments => [#{name => need, type => integer}]})),
  875:     ?assertEqual(Prog ++ ": invalid argument for need: cAnNotExIsT is not an existing atom", parser_error(["cAnNotExIsT"],
  876:         #{arguments => [#{name => need, type => atom}]})).
  877: 
  878: command_usage() ->
  879:     [{doc, "Test command help template"}].
  880: 
  881: command_usage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  882:     Cmd = #{arguments => [
  883:         #{name => arg, help => "argument help"}, #{name => opt, short => $o, help => "option help"}],
  884:         help => ["Options:\n", options, arguments, <<"NOTAUSAGE">>, usage, "\n"]
  885:     },
  886:     ?assertEqual("Options:\n  -o  option help\n  arg argument help\nNOTAUSAGE  " ++ prog() ++ " [-o <opt>] <arg>\n",
  887:         unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd, #{}))).
  888: 
  889: usage_width() ->
  890:     [{doc, "Test usage fitting in the viewport"}].
  891: 
  892: usage_width(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  893:     Cmd = #{arguments => [
  894:         #{name => arg, help => "argument help that spans way over allowed viewport width, wrapping words"},
  895:         #{name => opt, short => $o, long => "-option_long_name",
  896:             help => "another quite long word wrapped thing spanning over several lines"},
  897:         #{name => v, short => $v, type => boolean},
  898:         #{name => q, short => $q, type => boolean}],
  899:         commands => #{
  900:             "cmd1" => #{help => "Help for command number 1, not fitting at all"},
  901:             "cmd2" => #{help => <<"Short help">>},
  902:             "cmd3" => #{help => "Yet another instance of a very long help message"}
  903:         },
  904:         help => "  Very long help line taking much more than 40 characters allowed by the test case.
  905: Also containing a few newlines.
  906: 
  907:    Indented new lines must be honoured!"
  908:     },
  909: 
  910:     Expected = "Usage:\n  erl {cmd1|cmd2|cmd3} [-vq] [-o <opt>]\n"
  911:         "      [--option_long_name <opt>] <arg>\n\n"
  912:         "  Very long help line taking much more\n"
  913:         "than 40 characters allowed by the test\n"
  914:         "case.\n"
  915:         "Also containing a few newlines.\n\n"
  916:         "   Indented new lines must be honoured!\n\n"
  917:         "Subcommands:\n"
  918:         "  cmd1                   Help for\n"
  919:         "                         command number\n"
  920:         "                         1, not fitting\n"
  921:         "                         at all\n"
  922:         "  cmd2                   Short help\n"
  923:         "  cmd3                   Yet another\n"
  924:         "                         instance of a\n"
  925:         "                         very long help\n"
  926:         "                         message\n\n"
  927:         "Arguments:\n"
  928:         "  arg                    argument help\n"
  929:         "                         that spans way\n"
  930:         "                         over allowed\n"
  931:         "                         viewport width,\n"
  932:         "                         wrapping words\n\n"
  933:         "Optional arguments:\n"
  934:         "  -o, --option_long_name another quite\n"
  935:         "                         long word\n"
  936:         "                         wrapped thing\n"
  937:         "                         spanning over\n"
  938:         "                         several lines\n"
  939:         "  -v                     v\n"
  940:         "  -q                     q\n",
  941: 
  942:     ?assertEqual(Expected, unicode:characters_to_list(argparse:help(Cmd, #{columns => 40, progname => "erl"}))).
  943: 
  944: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  945: %% Validator Test Cases
  946: 
  947: validator_exception() ->
  948:     [{doc, "Tests that the validator throws expected exceptions"}].
  949: 
  950: validator_exception(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  951:     Prg = [prog()],
  952:     %% conflicting option names
  953:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, Prg, short, "short conflicting with previously defined short for one"},
  954:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => one, short => $$}, #{name => two, short => $$}]})),
  955:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, Prg, long, "long conflicting with previously defined long for one"},
  956:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => one, long => "a"}, #{name => two, long => "a"}]})),
  957:     %% broken options
  958:     %% long must be a string
  959:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, Prg, long, _},
  960:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => one, long => ok}]})),
  961:     %% short must be a printable character
  962:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, Prg, short, _},
  963:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => one, short => ok}]})),
  964:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, Prg, short, _},
  965:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => one, short => 7}]})),
  966:     %% required is a boolean
  967:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, Prg, required, _},
  968:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => one, required => ok}]})),
  969:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, Prg, help, _},
  970:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{name => one, help => ok}]})),
  971:     %% broken commands
  972:     try argparse:help(#{}, #{progname => 123}), ?assert(false)
  973:     catch error:badarg:Stack ->
  974:         [{_, _, _, Ext} | _] = Stack,
  975:         #{cause := #{2 := Detail}} = proplists:get_value(error_info, Ext),
  976:         ?assertEqual(<<"progname is not valid">>, Detail)
  977:     end,
  978:     %% not-a-list of arguments provided to a subcommand
  979:     Prog = prog(),
  980:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, command, [Prog, "start"], arguments, <<"expected a list, [argument()]">>},
  981:         argparse:validate(#{commands => #{"start" => #{arguments => atom}}})),
  982:     %% command is not a map
  983:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, command, Prg, commands, <<"expected map of #{string() => command()}">>},
  984:         argparse:validate(#{commands => []})),
  985:     %% invalid commands field
  986:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, command, Prg, commands, _},
  987:         argparse:validate(#{commands => ok})),
  988:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, command, _, commands, _},
  989:         argparse:validate(#{commands => #{ok => #{}}})),
  990:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, command, _, help,
  991:         <<"must be a printable unicode list, or a command help template">>},
  992:         argparse:validate(#{commands => #{"ok" => #{help => ok}}})),
  993:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, command, _, handler, _},
  994:         argparse:validate(#{commands => #{"ok" => #{handler => fun validator_exception/0}}})),
  995:     %% extend + maybe: validator exception
  996:     ?assertException(error, {argparse, argument, _, action, <<"extend action works only with lists">>},
  997:         parse("-1 -1", #{arguments =>
  998:         [#{action => extend, name => short49, nargs => 'maybe', short => 49}]})).
  999: 
 1000: validator_exception_format() ->
 1001:     [{doc, "Tests human-readable (EEP-54) format for exceptions thrown by the validator"}].
 1002: 
 1003: validator_exception_format(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1004:     %% set up as a contract: test that EEP-54 transformation is done (but don't check strings)
 1005:     try
 1006:         argparse:validate(#{commands => #{"one" => #{commands => #{"two" => atom}}}}),
 1007:         ?assert(false)
 1008:     catch
 1009:         error:R1:S1 ->
 1010:             #{1 := Cmd, reason := RR1, general := G} = argparse:format_error(R1, S1),
 1011:             ?assertEqual("command specification is invalid", unicode:characters_to_list(G)),
 1012:             ?assertEqual("command \"" ++ prog() ++ " one two\": invalid field 'commands', reason: expected command()",
 1013:                 unicode:characters_to_list(RR1)),
 1014:             ?assertEqual(["atom"], Cmd)
 1015:     end,
 1016:     %% check argument
 1017:     try
 1018:         argparse:validate(#{arguments => [#{}]}),
 1019:         ?assert(false)
 1020:     catch
 1021:         error:R2:S2 ->
 1022:             #{1 := Cmd2, reason := RR2, general := G2} = argparse:format_error(R2, S2),
 1023:             ?assertEqual("argument specification is invalid", unicode:characters_to_list(G2)),
 1024:             ?assertEqual("command \"" ++ prog() ++
 1025:                 "\", argument '', invalid field 'name': argument must be a map containing 'name' field",
 1026:                 unicode:characters_to_list(RR2)),
 1027:             ?assertEqual(["#{}"], Cmd2)
 1028:     end.
 1029: 
 1030: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1031: %% Validator Test Cases
 1032: 
 1033: run_handle() ->
 1034:     [{doc, "Very basic tests for argparse:run/3, choice of handlers formats"}].
 1035: 
 1036: %% fun((arg_map()) -> term()) |    %% handler accepting arg_map
 1037: %% {module(), Fn :: atom()} |      %% handler, accepting arg_map, Fn exported from module()
 1038: %% {fun(() -> term()), term()} |   %% handler, positional form (term() is supplied for omitted args)
 1039: %% {module(), atom(), term()}
 1040: 
 1041: run_handle(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1042:     %% no subcommand, basic fun handler with argmap
 1043:     ?assertEqual(6,
 1044:         argparse:run(["-i", "3"], #{handler => fun (#{in := Val}) -> Val * 2 end,
 1045:         arguments => [#{name => in, short => $i, type => integer}]}, #{})),
 1046:     %% subcommand, positional fun() handler
 1047:     ?assertEqual(6,
 1048:         argparse:run(["mul", "2", "3"], #{commands => #{"mul" => #{
 1049:             handler => {fun (match, L, R) -> L * R end, match},
 1050:             arguments => [#{name => opt, short => $o},
 1051:                 #{name => l, type => integer}, #{name => r, type => integer}]}}},
 1052:         #{})),
 1053:     %% no subcommand, positional module-based function
 1054:     ?assertEqual(6,
 1055:         argparse:run(["2", "3"], #{handler => {erlang, '*', undefined},
 1056:             arguments => [#{name => l, type => integer}, #{name => r, type => integer}]},
 1057:             #{})),
 1058:     %% subcommand, module-based function accepting argmap
 1059:     ?assertEqual([{arg, "arg"}],
 1060:         argparse:run(["map", "arg"], #{commands => #{"map" => #{
 1061:             handler => {maps, to_list},
 1062:             arguments => [#{name => arg}]}}},
 1063:             #{})).
